Valentino Park</Name> <Location>Coffey Street</Location> <Description/> <Hours>Dawn to Dusk</Hours> <Belongs_to_Parks>Yes</Belongs_to_Parks> <Launch___Land>Both</Launch___Land> <Storage>No Storage Available</Storage> <Available_Parking>Parking on Van Dyke St</Available_Parking> <lat>40.6786</lat> <lon>-74.0183</lon> </facility> <facility> <Prop_ID>B406</Prop_ID> <Name>Sebago Canoe Club (Paerdegat Basin)</Name> <Location>Paerdegat Avenue North</Location> <Description><p>"The Sebago Canoe Club is a volunteer run, 501C3 nonprofit, membership organization in Canarsie, Brooklyn.  The club, with it's pleasanet, tree-filled grounds is located on Paerdegat basin with direct access to the beautiful waters of Jamaica Bay."</p> <p> For more information regarding Sebago Canoe Club, please visit their website at <a href="http://sebagocanoeclub.org">sebagocanoeclub.org</a></p> <p>(Information provided by the Sebago Canoe Club website)</p> <p> </p> <p> </p></Description> <Hours/> <Belongs_to_Parks>Yes</Belongs_to_Parks> <Launch___Land>Both</Launch___Land> <Storage>Public Storage 10 kayaks, 10 canoes</Storage> <Available_Parking/> <lat>40.6264</lat> <lon>-73.9047</lon> </facility> <facility> <Prop_ID>B</Prop_ID> <Name>Mill Basin Marina</Name> <Location>Avenue Y & East 69th Street</Location> <Description/> <Hours>Sunrise to Sunset</Hours> <Belongs_to_Parks>Yes</Belongs_to_Parks> <Launch___Land>Launch</Launch___Land> <Storage>Winter storage for boats only</Storage> <Available_Parking/> <lat>40.6119</lat> <lon>-73.9025</lon> </facility> <facility> <Prop_ID>X088</Prop_ID> <Name>Clason Point Park</Name> <Location>Foot of Soundview Avenue & East River</Location> <Description><p>A concrete ramp provides access to marshes of Pugsley Creek, the East River, the Hutchinson River Drainage, and Long Island Sound. Portage is 150 feet.</p> <p>Caution: Strong currents in the East River, heavy commercial traffic, and lots of broken glass in Launch Area.</p></Description> <Hours/> <Belongs_to_Parks>Yes</Belongs_to_Parks> <Launch___Land>Launch Site</Launch___Land> <Storage>Public storage container</Storage> <Available_Parking>Street Parking</Available_Parking> <lat>40.8047</lat> <lon>-73.8486</lon> </facility> <facility> <Prop_ID>X336</Prop_ID> <Name>Hunts Point Riverside Park</Name> <Location>Lafayette Ave & Edgewater Rd</Location> <Description><p>A gravel beach offers access to the sheltered waters of the Bronx River. shipping channel.</p></Description> <Hours/> <Belongs_to_Parks>Yes</Belongs_to_Parks> <Launch___Land>Floating Pier</Launch___Land> <Storage>Private storage only (belongs to "rocking the boat</Storage> <Prop_ID>R046</Prop_ID> <Name>Midland Beach</Name> <Location>Father Capodanno Boulevard & Lincoln Avenue (Parking Lot)</Location> <Description><p>Midland Beach offers access to the Lower Harbor and Raritan Bay. The carry to the water is about 250 ft.</p><p>Caution: Raritan Bay and Lower Bay are open to the ocean, lauching and landing can be hazardous in high surf.</p></Description> <Hours/> <Belongs_to_Parks>Yes</Belongs_to_Parks> <Launch___Land/> <Storage/> <Available_Parking/> <lat>40.5683</lat> <lon>-74.0886</lon> </facility> <facility> <Prop_ID>R006</Prop_ID> <Name>Conference House</Name> <Location>Hylan Blvd & Satterlee Street</Location> <Description><p>The site of a legendary display of American defiance early in the Revolutionary War, and the southernmost point in the State. A long (800 ft.) but paved pedestrian path offers access to the Arthur Kill  and Raritan Bay.</p> <p>Caution: Semi-Submerged pilings north and south of the launch, and a major shipping channel 400 yards offshore.</p></Description> <Hours/> <Belongs_to_Parks>Yes</Belongs_to_Parks> <Launch___Land/> <Storage/> <Available_Parking/> <lat>40.5025</lat> <lon>-74.2544</lon> </facility> <facility> <Prop_ID>B</Prop_ID> <Name>Newtown Creek</Name> <Location>Provost Street and Paige Avenue, Greenpoint</Location> <Description><p>Landing only at tiered steps going to a nature path at a wastewater treatment plant, operated by the NYC Departement of Environmental protection. There is always portage about 200 yards on a curving pathway.</p> <p>Caution: This waterway haas been designated by the EPA Superfund sites for the presence of Hazardous Substances (see <a href="http://www.nyc.gov/dep">www.nyc.gov/dep</a>); see cautionary informationin the box below.</p></Description> <Hours>Temporarily Closed</Hours> <Belongs_to_Parks>No</Belongs_to_Parks> <Location>W.202nd Street</Location> <Description><p>This launch has good access to the bucolic Harlem River.</p> <p>Caution: Local college crews row on the Harlem River.</p></Description> <Hours/> <Belongs_to_Parks>Yes</Belongs_to_Parks> <Launch___Land/> <Storage/> <Available_Parking/> <lat>40.8603</lat> <lon>-73.9183</lon> </facility> <facility> <Prop_ID>R016</Prop_ID> <Name>Great Kills Park</Name> <Location>Hylan Blvd & Buffalo Street</Location> <Description><p>Located on a peninsula in Staten Island, Great Kills Park is almost 600 acres of open space where visitors can enjoy many recreational amenities or explore the wildlife still thriving in New York City.  The name "Great Kills" originates from a Dutch word meaning "many creeks."  Today, the waters are popular with boaters and fisherman alike.  Kayak launching is available at both the marina and the beach.</p> <p>For more information, please visit the New York Harbor Parks "Great Kills" website page by clicking <a href="http://www.nyharborparks.org/visit/grki.html">here</a>.</p> <p>(Information provided by the New York Harbor Parks "Great Kills" website page)</p></Description> <Hours/> <lat>40.8844</lat> <lon>-73.8672</lon> </facility> <facility> <Prop_ID>X305</Prop_ID> <Name>Concrete Plant Park</Name> <Location>Westchester Avenue or Bruckner Boulevard</Location> <Description><p>A concrete launch ramp at a reclaimed cement manufacturing site on the Bronx River. Limited street parking and a long carry from either the Westchester Ave. ( .25 mi.) or Bruckner Blvd. ( .15 mi.) entrance.</p> <p>Caution: A boom spanning the river collects debris and helps prevent motorized traffic from going north; to the south are strong currents and a working shipping channel.</p></Description> <Hours>Dawn to Dusk</Hours> <Belongs_to_Parks>Yes</Belongs_to_Parks> <Launch___Land/> <Storage/> <Available_Parking/> <lat>40.8275</lat> <lon>-73.8847</lon> </facility> <facility> <Prop_ID>B</Prop_ID> <Name>Manhattan Avenue</Name> <Location>Manhattan Avenue Street-end, Greenpoint</Location> <Description/> <Hours>This site is now open for use.</Hours> <Belongs_to_Parks>Yes</Belongs_to_Parks> <Launch___Land/> <Storage/> <Available_Parking/> <lat>40.7389</lat> <lon>-73.9553</lon> </facility> <facility> <Prop_ID>B431</Prop_ID> <Name>Brooklyn Bridge Park (DUMBO)</Name> <Location>One Main Street, DUMBO</Location> <Description/> <Hours>Park: 6:00am-1:00am</Hours> <Belongs_to_Parks>Yes</Belongs_to_Parks> <Launch___Land/> <Storage/> <Available_Parking/> <lat>40.7042</lat> <lon>-73.9903</lon> </facility> <facility> <Prop_ID>B</Prop_ID> <Name>Plumb Beach</Name> <Location>East bound Belt Parkway, just east of Exit 9 Knapp Street</Location> <Description><p>Calm waters and strong winds make the sand beach a favorite take off for windsurfers and kite boarders. Launching is recommended at higher tide as mud flats make the walk to water several hundred yards at low tide. A permit is required.</p> <p>Caution: Do not disturb the horseshoe crabs in this prime breeding area. Challenging wind and tide conditions. Watch for glass on the beach.</p></Description> <Hours/> <Belongs_to_Parks>Yes</Belongs_to_Parks> <Launch___Land/> <Storage/> <Available_Parking/> <lat>40.5828</lat> <lon>-73.9211</lon> </facility> <facility> <Prop_ID>Q</Prop_ID> <Name>North Channel Beach (Gateway National Parks)</Name> <Location>Cross Bay Boulevard, south end of Addabbo Bridge, Broad Channel</Location> <Description><p>The sand beach launch on the eastside goes in the Grassy Bayportion of Jamaica Bay, a popular kayak fishing destination, wesy side launch opens to Pumpkin Pacth Channel and North Channel.</p> <p>Caution: Heavy pleasure boat traffic in Jamaica Bay, stay clear of channels. This is a wildlife refuge, do not land on islands nor disturb the flora or fauna.</p></Description> <Hours>5 a.m. to 11 p.m.</Hours> <Belongs_to_Parks>Yes</Belongs_to_Parks> <Launch___Land/> <Storage/> <Available_Parking/> <lat>40.6356</lat> <lon>-73.8247</lon> </facility> <facility> <Prop_ID>M</Prop_ID> <Name>West Harlem Piers</Name> <Location>130th Street & Marginal Street, Harlem</Location> <Description/> <Hours>Park: 9:00am-9:00pm; Launch: Sunrise to Sunset</Hours> <Belongs_to_Parks>Yes</Belongs_to_Parks> <Launch___Land/> <Storage/> <Available_Parking/> <lat>40.8206</lat> <lon>-73.9597</lon> </facility> <facility> <Prop_ID>M</Prop_ID> <Name>Govenors Island</Name> <Location>Pier 101, near the Brooklyn Battery Tunnel Vent</Location> <Description/> <Hours>See Site Restrictions</Hours> <Belongs_to_Parks>Yes</Belongs_to_Parks> <Launch___Land/> <Storage/> <Available_Parking/> <lat>40.6914</lat> <lon>-74.0122</lon> </facility> <facility> <Prop_ID>X118</Prop_ID> <Name>Soundview Park</Name> <Location>O'Brien Avenue at Leland Avenue, Soundview</Location> <Description><p>Enter the park and make a left off the main path to an asphalt  ramp located near the confluence of the Bronx River and East River (about a three block portage from street parking). The area offers expansive views of the river, migratory birds and the distant Manhattan skyline.</p> <p>Caution: Barge traffic and other motor boats.</p></Description> <Hours>Dusk to Dawn</Hours> <Belongs_to_Parks>Yes</Belongs_to_Parks> <Launch___Land/> <Storage/> <Available_Parking/> <lat>40.8094</lat> <lon>-73.8603</lon> </facility> <facility> <Prop_ID>M</Prop_ID> <Name>Hudson River Park (Pier 25)</Name> <Location>West Street, between Moore Street and Harrison Street</Location> <Description><p>The NYC Water Trail is an ongoing project.  For more information on a trail or to provide information on a trail please send an email to <a href="mailto:Water.Trail@parks.nyc.gov">Water.Trail@parks.nyc.gov</a>.</p> <p>A new addition to the Hudson River Park, Pier 25 is a lovely addition to the New York City Water Trail.  For more information regarding the dock at Pier 25, please visit the Hudson River Park website at:</p> <p><a
